title: The Venetians: A New History (2013 - Retail epub)
description:
Books : History : English

Paul Strathern, "The Venetians: A New History: From Marco Polo to Casanova"
ISBN: 1605984892 | 2013 | EPUB/MOBI | 368 pages | 3 MB/3 MB

A colorful new history of Venice that illuminates the character of the great city-state by shining a light on some of the most celebrated personalities of European historyÃ¢â‚¬â€Petrarch, Marco Polo, Galileo, Titian, Vivaldi, and Casanova.

The Republic of Venice was the first great economic, cultural, and naval power of the modern Western world. After winning the struggle for ascendency in the late 13th century, the Republic enjoyed centuries of unprecedented glory and built a trading empire which at its apogee reached as far afield as China, Syria and West Africa. This golden period only drew to an end with the RepublicÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s eventual surrender to Napoleon.

The Venetians illuminates the character of the Republic during these illustrious years by shining a light on some of the most celebrated personalities of European historyÃ¢â‚¬â€Petrarch, Marco Polo, Galileo, Titian, Vivaldi, Casanova. Frequently, though, these emblems of the city found themselves at odds with the Venetian authorities who prized stability above all else, and were notoriously suspicious of any "cult of personality." Was this very tension perhaps the engine for the RepublicÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s unprecedented rise?

Rich with biographies of some of the most exalted characters who have ever lived, The Venetians is a refreshing and authoritative new look at the history of the most evocative of city states.

16 pages of B&W and color photographs
